arm_group.description: Receives the full Healthy, Safe, and Tobacco-Free Worksites intervention

Receives abbreviated 2-month delayed intervention designed to provide employees with knowledge and skills to quit tobacco after final data collection time point, as well as one non-tobacco event in between data collection points.

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators are designing and testing the effectiveness of an integrated tobacco
      control and occupational health (OH) intervention aimed at promoting tobacco cessation among
      workers and supporting the adoption, implementation, and enforcement of tobacco control
      policies in 20 manufacturing worksites in the greater Mumbai region of India.

detailed_description.textblock:
Through 6 health education events at the worksites, blue-collar workers (who face dual
      health risks through their exposures to occupational hazards and their high rates of tobacco
      use) will gain the knowledge, skills, and social support needed to quit tobacco use.

      Simultaneously, management will receive OH and tobacco policy consultations to help build a
      healthy and safe work environment, where workers' hazardous exposures are reduced.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Manufacturing worksites located in the Mumbai, Thane, or Raigad districts of India

          -  Employ at least 60% production workers/40% administrative staff OR at employ at least
             200 production workers on staff.  NOTE: We are defining "workers" as anyone who is on
             the company roster, regardless of whether they're permanent or contractual

          -  Companies must be autonomous decision-makers and allow us to function at their
             worksite

          -  Companies must be willing to provide us with a current employee roster

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Employees do not speak English, Hindi, or Marathi

intervention.description:
Receives an integrated tobacco control and occupational health (OH) intervention (The Healthy, Safe, and Tobacco-Free Worksites program) aimed at promoting tobacco cessation among workers and supporting the adoption, implementation, and enforcement of tobacco control policies.
Through six health education events at the worksites, blue-collar workers (who face dual health risks through their exposures to occupational hazards and their high rates of tobacco use) will gain the knowledge, skills, and social support needed to quit tobacco use.
Simultaneously, management will receive OH and tobacco policy consultations to help build a healthy and safe work environment, where workers' hazardous exposures are reduced.
intervention.other_name: Healthy, Safe, and Tobacco-Free Worksites Program

intervention.description: Receives abbreviated 2-month delayed intervention designed to provide employees with knowledge and skills to quit tobacco after final data collection time point, as well as one non-tobacco event in between data collection points.
